result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan Michael Pattee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dylan Michael Pattee is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dylan Michael Pattee was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 21CF352 and 21CF423 and Consecutive to 21CF38 and 20CF502
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan Michael Pattee

records.addlTxt:
3:19 PM Defendant Dylan Michael Pattee in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Dylan Michael Pattee.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases. State indicates joint recommendation for costs only in all 3 files. 30 days on 22CF30, 6 months on 21CF352, 6 months on 21CF423, will dismiss repeater in 22CF30. concurrent to each other and consecutive to 21CF38 and 20CF502, 13 days credit on each file. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. Remaining counts are dismissed. 
Court orders on 21cf352, 6 months, costs, in 21cf423, 6 months, costs, in 22cf30 30 days, costs, 13 days credit, concurrent with each other and consecutive to 21CF38 and 20CF502. 6 months to pay or pay plan.

10:37 AM Defendant Dylan Michael Pattee in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Dylan Michael Pattee.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State believes matter is resolved and asks for short turnaround for plea/sentencing. Attorney Rosenthal asks for time not at morning statuses. Court sets plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

10:18 AM Defendant Dylan Michael Pattee in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Dylan Michael Pattee.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State- has received counteroffer, requests status
Court sets date
Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:12 AM Defendant Dylan Michael Pattee in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Dylan Michael Pattee.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases.  State conveyed offer. Attorney Rosenthal received offer, spoke to client. Asks for more time, 30 days.
Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:02 AM Defendant Dylan Michael Pattee in court and in-custody with attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 21CF423 and 22CF30 are here on arrignmanet. Atty Rosenthal acknowledges receipt of compaint and waives further reading, enters pleas of not guilty. Court accepts plea of not guilty. Atty Rosenthal is requesting another status conference with in 45 days.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed in both cases and binds over for arraignments.  Court reminds of bail/conditions. records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a dangerous weapon.  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription, notify Clerk of Courts office within 24 hours of release from Jail with updated address.

01:52 PM Defendant Dylan Michael Pattee in court with attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal.  Defendant Dylan Michael Pattee in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dylan Michael Pattee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Court accepts plea and will schedule Preliminary hearing.   States request on bail: $1000 cash bail with conditions of  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. 
Atty Rosenthal does not object to State's request.
Court Orders $1000 cash with conditions of   No use or possession of a dangerous weapon.  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription, notify Clerk of Courts office within 24 hours of release from Jail with updated address.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 10:45 am.
